text: Richard Kylea Cowie Jr. MBE (born 19 January 1979), better known by his stage name Wiley (formerly Wiley Kat), is a British grime MC, rapper, songwriter, DJ and record producer from Bow, London. He is known for making grime music. He is from the group Roll Deep. Wiley was regarded as the "Godfather of Grime". He had hit singles such as "Wot Do U Call It?", "Boasty", "Take That", "Wearing My Rolex", and "Heatwave". Wiley's eleventh album, Godfather (2017), went to number nine on the UK Albums Chart. It became his highest-charting album of his career and won an "Outstanding Contribution to Music" award by the NME. He has collaborated with artists such as Emeli Sand√©, Ed Sheeran, Skepta, Dizzee Rascal, Tinchy Stryder, and Dot Rotten. He was a member of the UK garage band Pay As U Go. He is of Antigua & Barbuda and Trinidadian descent. ==References== Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:Antigua and Barbuda people Category:British DJs Category:British record producers Category:Hip hop record producers Category:English rappers Category:English songwriters Category:Grime music artists Category:Musicians from London Category:Trinidad and Tobago musicians
title: Wiley (musician)
